name: Croatia
text: The Croatians accurately blamed Neymar and the ref for their loss yesterday. Said the Croatian manager Niko Kovac, per Google Translate, "This is a disgrace! The seizure! You'd better go home. If this penalty, let's go play basketball."

name: Brazil
text: Brazil loves the ref.

name: Australia
text: The Australians are less focused on their chances at this World Cup--the Socceroos take to the field in Brazil with a snowflake's chance in Ipanema of winning--than their chances of recouping their losses trying to host the 2022 edition.

name: Chile
text: Chile is excited that star-man Arturo Vidal, who missed the end of his club season due to knee surgery, will start today's match against Australia. Australia is right to be afraid.

name: Netherlands
text: The Dutch fans in Brazil were ready to get the party started early ahead of this afternoon's huge match against Spain, with fans getting to Salvador's "Orange Square" at 8 a.m. Naturally, the venue wasn't ready yet.

name: Spain
text: The Spaniards look to pick up where they left off: "The last thing Spain did in a World Cup competition was win it."

name: Mexico
text: Mexico isn't tripping about their opener: "Mexico hunts the 'Indomitable Lions.'"

name: Cameroon
text: Cameroon's manager is already annoyed: "Western journalists would want to make us believe that none of their countries get to the World Cup free of problems. [...] I bet the US team has its own problems too. We don't know why Donovan was left out of the squad."
